{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2960997,"name":"PhilBot","username":"PhilBot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/philbot/{size}/1824_2.png","created_at":"2021-07-05T17:14:32.412Z","cooked":"

This is not for an FRC robot, but you guys are a font of information.

I have a Gear Motor with an 7/16" dia. keyed output shaft.
It comes with a sprocket for 1/2" roller chain. But I need to drive a 3/8" (#35) wheel sprocket.

I though it would be easier to replace the drive sprocket (so I didn’t have to match the wheel mounting holes and use a monster chain) but I just can find any 7/16" bore #35 drive sprockets (10 to 14 teeth).

Anyone have a magic supplier? I’ve spent several hours googling.
Most of the search results are for 1 7/16 bore, so they get me excited and then drop me flat

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":40,"updated_at":"2021-07-05T17:14:32.412Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":315,"reads":302,"readers_count":301,"score":1635.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":394942,"topic_slug":"looking-for-source-of-sprocket-with-7-16-bore","display_username":"PhilBot","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":5633,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/looking-for-source-of-sprocket-with-7-16-bore/394942/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":2960998,"name":"Clayton Ramsey","username":"ClayTownR","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/claytownr/{size}/158381_2.png","created_at":"2021-07-05T17:24:15.315Z","cooked":"

That’s a pretty oddball size. The easiest thing might be to get a 3/8" round bore sprocket and then drill it out to 7/16".

A quick poke on SDP-SI shows that you can get 3/8" bore #35 sprockets in tooth counts from 9 to 12.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":40,"updated_at":"2021-07-05T17:24:15.315Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":300,"readers_count":299,"score":70.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":394942,"topic_slug":"looking-for-source-of-sprocket-with-7-16-bore","display_username":"Clayton Ramsey","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://shop.sdp-si.com/catalog/?cid=p585&filter=a0%3A2%3A0.375%20(%2335)%3Ba112%3A2%3A0.375&sort=undefined&view=table","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Catalog | Designatronics Store | Stock Drive Products/Sterling Instrument","clicks":6}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28741,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"100 Alum"},"post_url":"/t/looking-for-source-of-sprocket-with-7-16-bore/394942/2","custom_user_title":"100 Alum","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2961002,"name":"Troy Dietz","username":"troy_dietz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/troy_dietz/{size}/135768_2.png","created_at":"2021-07-05T18:48:11.901Z","cooked":"

There’s a chance you could also find a suitable adapter. Iirc they exist for 7/16” to 1/2” keyed, but it’s a China rabbit hole.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":40,"updated_at":"2021-07-05T18:48:11.901Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":286,"readers_count":285,"score":82.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":394942,"topic_slug":"looking-for-source-of-sprocket-with-7-16-bore","display_username":"Troy Dietz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26760,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"❤️ conflict-free COTS"},"post_url":"/t/looking-for-source-of-sprocket-with-7-16-bore/394942/3","custom_user_title":"❤️ conflict-free COTS","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2961007,"name":"Stewart Riley","username":"Strategic","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/strategic/{size}/10157_2.png","created_at":"2021-07-05T21:06:08.235Z","cooked":"

7/16" is a very odd size for the shaft. Chances are you just won’t find a #35 sprocket that fits your specifications. I’d suggest the same idea as ClayTownR: buy a 3/8" bore sprocket (McMaster-Carr has a 10 tooth one pretty cheap) and drill/machine it out to 7/16". It’s about the surest way you’ll have of getting what you need.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":40,"updated_at":"2021-07-05T21:06:36.956Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":252,"readers_count":251,"score":95.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":394942,"topic_slug":"looking-for-source-of-sprocket-with-7-16-bore","display_username":"Stewart Riley","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.mcmaster.com/6280K321/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"McMaster-Carr","clicks":6}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32783,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I plan, therefore I am"},"post_url":"/t/looking-for-source-of-sprocket-with-7-16-bore/394942/4","custom_user_title":"I plan, therefore I am","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2961009,"name":"Karthik Kanagasabapathy (he/him)","username":"Karthik","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/karthik/{size}/165693_2.png","created_at":"2021-07-05T21:37:12.897Z","cooked":"
troy_dietz:

There’s a chance you could also find a suitable adapter.

Something 1114 has done in the past was to use tube stock as an adapter. Here’s some 1/2" OD, 7/16" ID steel tube that might be useful. (Or might be worth more trouble than it’s worth, YMMV)

But yeah, boring out a sprocket on your own seems like the most efficient solution, provided you have access to the machines/tools needed.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":40,"updated_at":"2021-07-05T21:37:12.897Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":242,"readers_count":241,"score":118.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":394942,"topic_slug":"looking-for-source-of-sprocket-with-7-16-bore","display_username":"Karthik Kanagasabapathy (he/him)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.mcmaster.com/1991t13/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"McMaster-Carr","clicks":16}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":967,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/looking-for-source-of-sprocket-with-7-16-bore/394942/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2961012,"name":"PhilBot","username":"PhilBot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/philbot/{size}/1824_2.png","created_at":"2021-07-05T21:59:34.270Z","cooked":"

Thanks…

Various replies to drill out a smaller bore, or use an adapter are all worth considering. My main worry is that it’s keyed, so can I adapt the key as well as the bore? Hmm…

I’ll follow some of these leads…

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":40,"updated_at":"2021-07-05T21:59:34.270Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":228,"readers_count":227,"score":70.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":394942,"topic_slug":"looking-for-source-of-sprocket-with-7-16-bore","display_username":"PhilBot","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":967,"username":"Karthik","name":"Karthik Kanagasabapathy (he/him)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/karthik/{size}/165693_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":5633,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/looking-for-source-of-sprocket-with-7-16-bore/394942/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2961013,"name":"Chadfrom7226","username":"Chadfrom7226","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chadfrom7226/{size}/113429_2.png","created_at":"2021-07-05T22:07:44.691Z","cooked":"

You could make one if you have access to a CNC machine

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":40,"updated_at":"2021-07-05T22:07:44.691Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":218,"readers_count":217,"score":48.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":394942,"topic_slug":"looking-for-source-of-sprocket-with-7-16-bore","display_username":"Chadfrom7226","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20021,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/looking-for-source-of-sprocket-with-7-16-bore/394942/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2961029,"name":"Troy Dietz","username":"troy_dietz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/troy_dietz/{size}/135768_2.png","created_at":"2021-07-06T00:44:09.131Z","cooked":"

You’d take Karthik’s part, then cut a slice out for a rectangular key that spans from the drive shaft to the sprocket keyway. I’ve done it for something before, but it’s certainly not my first choice.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":40,"updated_at":"2021-07-06T00:44:09.131Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":200,"readers_count":199,"score":90.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":394942,"topic_slug":"looking-for-source-of-sprocket-with-7-16-bore","display_username":"Troy Dietz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":5633,"username":"PhilBot","name":"PhilBot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/philbot/{size}/1824_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26760,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"❤️ conflict-free COTS"},"post_url":"/t/looking-for-source-of-sprocket-with-7-16-bore/394942/8","custom_user_title":"❤️ conflict-free COTS","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2961030,"name":"JVerstraete","username":"JVerstraete","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/258eb7/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-07-06T00:49:00.803Z","cooked":"

One option would be to find a shop with a Wire EDM and have them cut the hole and the keyway at the same time. It might not be the cheapest option but it will get the job done.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":40,"updated_at":"2021-07-06T00:49:00.803Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":196,"readers_count":195,"score":44.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":394942,"topic_slug":"looking-for-source-of-sprocket-with-7-16-bore","display_username":"JVerstraete","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":5633,"username":"PhilBot","name":"PhilBot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/philbot/{size}/1824_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22701,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/looking-for-source-of-sprocket-with-7-16-bore/394942/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2961034,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2021-07-06T01:20:59.095Z","cooked":"

You could probably adapt the key, but it’ll take a good eye when lining up the broach, and make sure that the new key size is equal to or larger than the old one.

Or just cut a new keyway.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":40,"updated_at":"2021-07-06T01:20:59.095Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":187,"readers_count":186,"score":42.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":394942,"topic_slug":"looking-for-source-of-sprocket-with-7-16-bore","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":5633,"username":"PhilBot","name":"PhilBot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/philbot/{size}/1824_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/looking-for-source-of-sprocket-with-7-16-bore/394942/10","custom_user_title":"#westandwithUkraine","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2961046,"name":"sanddrag","username":"sanddrag","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/c68b51/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-07-06T04:54:21.372Z","cooked":"

Are you sure it isn’t 11mm ? 11mm is just a hair under 7/16 inch. While 11mm bore sprockets aren’t common, they are a thing, sort of. Misumi USA shows them.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":40,"updated_at":"2021-07-06T04:54:21.372Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":168,"readers_count":167,"score":108.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":394942,"topic_slug":"looking-for-source-of-sprocket-with-7-16-bore","display_username":"sanddrag","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":1082,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/looking-for-source-of-sprocket-with-7-16-bore/394942/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2961050,"name":"Richard Wallace","username":"Richard_Wallace","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/richard_wallace/{size}/110760_2.png","created_at":"2021-07-06T09:05:16.192Z","cooked":"

Strangely, although 7/16” and 11mm are pretty close, their respective standard key sizes are not.

7/16” shafts take a 3/32” key.
11mm shafts take a 4mm key.

OP: what size is the key you need to fit?

Yeah… for $264 I could buy two new motors with better output shafts I guess I didn’t mention that this was a low budget project.

PhilBot:

It turns out the key is 4 mm wide

PhilBot:

if I try several places, I can get the inch measurement down to .433

Taken together, these point strongly to an 11mm shaft diameter.

Possible solution:
  1. Buy a 1/2" hex bore sprocket from one of our fine FRC suppliers
  2. Get a short (~0.75") piece of 1/2" hex stock, or Thunderhex.
  3. On a lathe, drill the hex stock to fit 11mm shaft snugly.
  4. With mill, saw, file, etc., cut key slot 4mm wide in hex adapter.
  5. On mill (or grinder?) take about 1mm off of one face of the 4mm key.
  6. Assemble as shown:
    image1053×585 94.5 KB
